title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act titled "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" includes findings and declarations. The "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" emphasizes the importance of accurate and timely information on economic development programs for the national economy and regions suffering from unemployment. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have been successful in providing such information. The "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" aims to expand economic development information to assist areas facing economic distress or long-term deterioration, providing access to various government resources in a user-friendly format. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 aims to expand economic development information for areas in need, while the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include an Office of Economic Development Information. The Secretary shall establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration to serve as a central information clearinghouse on economic development programs, assist applicants in locating and applying for assistance, and develop electronic links to information databases. The Office of Economic Development Information assists agencies, entities, and individuals in identifying and applying for economic development programs at the Federal, State, and local levels. It develops electronic links to databases with information on available programs, contact personnel, application process, eligibility criteria, and follow-up procedures. The Office of Economic Development Information provides assistance in identifying and applying for economic development programs at various government levels. This includes information on economic data, trends, case studies, best practices, technology utilization programs, and compilations of published works related to economic development. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for accessing revolving loan fund programs, finance programs, and capital sources for businesses. They also offer assistance in understanding and pursuing sustainable development initiatives. The Office ensures public access to their information clearinghouse in a user-friendly and culturally neutral manner. The Office of Economic Development Information provides various means for accessing data services, including an Internet website, a toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, orientation workshops, and on-call information specialists. The Office of Economic Development Information offers multiple ways to access data services, including an Internet website, a toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, orientation workshops, and on-call specialists for person-to-person assistance. Coordination with other federal departments and agencies is required to achieve the objectives of economic development, which encompasses economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this section.
